thread.title: Stranger who calmed crying baby on plane captures hearts

title: Stranger who calmed crying baby on plane captures hearts
text:
Stranger who calmed crying baby on plane captures hearts Last updated 12:29, September 30 2015 Rebekka Garvison/Facebook 
This beautiful image has been shared over 80,000 times since being posted on Facebook. 
Those who've ever travelled with babies or small children know how difficult it can be. 
Not only do you have to look after a small child, who wants nothing more than to pull the hair of the person sitting next to you, before playing a game of lets crawl up and down the aisle while people are trying to sleep, you also have to all being mindful of your fellow passengers. 
In a nutshell, travelling with children is hard work, especially if you are doing it solo. 
The above scenario is similar to a flight experienced by Rebekka Garvison, who was travelling alone with her newborn daughter Rylee. 
But luckily for Garvison - her flight ended up enriching her heart - thanks to the kindness of a complete stranger. 
In a recent Facebook post . Garvison wrote about her gratitude to a woman who happened to be sitting next to her on the plane. 
"Something amazing happened to me today and I will never be able to express how grateful I am for it." Garvison posted. 
"If anyone has ever travelled with an infant you know how stressful it can be. Today, I was reminded that there truly are absolutely AMAZING individuals in this world even if they are complete strangers to you." 
Garvison went onto explain how she was already stressed about travelling alone with her baby before she took flight, and her fears were founded once she boarded the plane. As she went to take her seat, she noticed a couple "looking very annoyed" so when her daughter started crying, she asked if she could be moved to two empty seats next to each other. Ad Feedback 
What happened next was truly touching. 
"Next thing I know I was sitting next to this amazing woman! I'm not sure if she could tell how stressed and upset I looked or what, but she turned our day completely around. Rylee wouldn't stop crying no matter what I would try and do....so she had asked if I didn't mind if she tried and of course I let her." Garvison wrote. 
"As soon as she had her, Rylee was looking out the window and stopped crying. When we got in the air she fell right asleep and slept in her lap the whole flight until we got to our gate. She kept saying it wasn't a problem at all and it was actually a comforting feeling for her. She even carried her off the plane and held her so I could get the stroller and carseat put back together so I wasn't struggling to try and do it all alone." 
The woman sitting next to Garvison was Nyfesha Miller . 
Both women left the flight as strangers, but since Garvison posted her message to Facebook it has been shared over 80,000 times, and Miller was just as grateful for their meeting. 
"Hard to believe how this has become a trending story, turned viral!....So unexpectedly, unbelievable! Huge thanks to every single person for your kind words and posts! Extra special thanks to new mommy & military wife, Rebekka Garvison , who I had the honour, privilege & blessing to meet and assist. She's truly a sweet, loving mommy & wife, who deserves all the accolades. God Bless you all!!" Miller wrote on Facebook. - Stuff
